newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican daily port, shipping update for Dec 4.
newsitem.headline: Mexican daily port, shipping update for Dec 4.

text.p: Shipping warnings were posted Wednesday in the Gulf of Tehuantepec off the coast of Oaxaca and Chiapas states because of high winds and sea swells, the Communications and Transportation Ministry said in a daily update.
All major ports were open as of 1000 local/1600 GMT to large vessels, but Salina Cruz in Oaxaca was shut to minor shipping, namely fishing and tourist boats, it added.
The ministry updated port conditions and shipping warnings for the Gulf of Mexico, Caribbean and Pacific Coast.

Light rains along the coast of southern Baja California, Sonora, Sinaloa, Nayarit and Jalisco states and a little heavier in Colima state. Winds from the north and northeast of 15 to 20 knots (28 to 37 kilometers/17 to 22 miles per hour).

Light to moderate rains and cloud in the northerly part of the Gulf with dominating winds from the north and northeast at 10 to 15 knots (19 to 28 kilometers/11 to 17 miles per hour) that will changed to south, southeastly winds overnight.
Tropical air carrying scant light rains over the coast of Quintana Roo state and Belize. Winds from the northeast at 10 to 15 knots with waves three to five feet high.
